org.springframework.cloud.sleuth

Class Span

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.cloud.sleuth.Span

  • public class Span
extends Object
    Class for gathering and reporting statistics about a block of execution.

    Spans should form a directed acyclic graph structure. It should be possible to keep following the parents of a span until you arrive at a span with no parents.

    Spans can be either annotated with tags or logs.

    An Annotation is used to record existence of an event in time. Below you can find some of the core annotations used to define the start and stop of a request:

    • cs - Client Sent
    • sr - Server Received
    • ss - Server Sent
    • cr - Client Received
    Spring Cloud Sleuth uses Zipkin compatible header names
    • X-B3-TraceId: 64 encoded bits
    • X-B3-SpanId: 64 encoded bits
    • X-B3-ParentSpanId: 64 encoded bits
    • X-B3-Sampled: Boolean (either “1” or “0”)
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Spencer Gibb, Marcin Grzejszczak

      • CLIENT_RECV

        public static final String CLIENT_RECV
        cr - Client Receive. Signifies the end of the span. The client has successfully received the response from the server side. If one subtracts the cs timestamp from this timestamp one will receive the whole time needed by the client to receive the response from the server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_SEND

        public static final String CLIENT_SEND
        cs - Client Sent. The client has made a request (a client can be e.g. RestTemplate. This annotation depicts the start of the span.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_RECV

        public static final String SERVER_RECV
        sr - Server Receive. The server side got the request and will start processing it. If one subtracts the cs timestamp from this timestamp one will receive the network latency.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_SEND

        public static final String SERVER_SEND
        ss - Server Send. Annotated upon completion of request processing (when the response got sent back to the client). If one subtracts the sr timestamp from this timestamp one will receive the time needed by the server side to process the request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPAN_PEER_SERVICE_TAG_NAME

        public static final String SPAN_PEER_SERVICE_TAG_NAME
        As in Open Tracing
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Span

        public Span(Span current,
            Span savedSpan)
        Creates a new span that still tracks tags and logs of the current span. This is crucial when continuing spans since the changes in those collections done in the continued span need to be reflected until the span gets closed.

      • getAccumulatedMillis

        @Deprecated
public long getAccumulatedMillis()
        Deprecated. use getAccumulatedMicros() as it is more precise.
        Return the total amount of time elapsed since start was called, if running, or difference between stop and start

      • getAccumulatedMicros

        public long getAccumulatedMicros()
        Return the total amount of time elapsed since start was called, if running, or difference between stop and start, in microseconds. Note that in case of the spans that have CS / CR events we will not send to Zipkin the accumulated microseconds but will calculate the duration basing on the timestamps of the CS / CR events.
        Returns:
        zero if not running, or a positive number of microseconds.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Has the span been started and not yet stopped?

      • tag

        public void tag(String key,
                String value)
        Add a tag or data annotation associated with this span. The tag will be added only if it has a value.

      • logEvent

        public void logEvent(String event)
        Add an event to the timeline associated with this span.

      • tags

        public Map<String,String> tags()
        Get tag data associated with this span (read only)

        Will never be null.

      • logs

        public List<Log> logs()
        Get any timestamped events (read only)

        Will never be null.

      • getSavedSpan

        public Span getSavedSpan()
        Returns the saved span. The one that was "current" before this span.

        Might be null

      • hasSavedSpan

        public boolean hasSavedSpan()

      • getName

        public String getName()
        A human-readable name assigned to this span instance.

      • getSpanId

        public long getSpanId()
        A pseudo-unique (random) number assigned to this span instance.

        The span id is immutable and cannot be changed. It is safe to access this from multiple threads.

      • getTraceId

        public long getTraceId()
        A pseudo-unique (random) number assigned to the trace associated with this span

      • getProcessId

        public String getProcessId()
        Return a unique id for the process from which this span originated.

        Might be null

      • getParents

        public List<Long> getParents()
        Returns the parent IDs of the span.

        The collection will be empty if there are no parents.

      • isRemote

        public boolean isRemote()
        Flag that tells us whether the span was started in another process. Useful in RPC tracing when the receiver actually has to add annotations to the senders span.

      • getBegin

        public long getBegin()
        Get the start time, in milliseconds

      • getEnd

        public long getEnd()
        Get the stop time, in milliseconds

      • isExportable

        public boolean isExportable()
        Is the span eligible for export? If not then we may not need accumulate annotations (for instance).
